text:
(1)
East River, New York's skyline, between Broome Street (right) and the Manhattan Bridge, showing prominently the Hecker Flour Building at the S.E. corner of Corlears and Water Streets. Also shown (left background), faintly, is the Lower Manhattan skyline. March 24, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view and showing (extreme right) a portion of the Williamsburg Bridge. In midstream is seen the ferryboat "Tremont." March 24, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date, showing a closer view. On the right is shown pier 39 at the foot of Grand Street. September 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of lower Manhattan - South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - Broome Street - Manhattan Bridge.

text:
Corlears Street, at the N.E. corner of Water Street, as seen from Corlears Hook Park.
September 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
